alert.note: Alert for Switzerland (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 4:26AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana and Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Switzerland. In Northern Kentucky, Boone, Gallatin, Grant and Kenton. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 424 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Warsaw, Napoleon, Verona, Ryle, Munk, Crittenden, Independence, Walton, Patriot, Florence, Kentucky Speedway, Ryland Heights, Glencoe, Sparta, Steele Bottom, Big Bone Lick, Elliston and Egypt Bottom.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
